Also, when presented with a burn proof created over at Incognito Chain, releases the tokens back to user","methods":{"constructor":{"details":"Creates new Vault to hold assets for Incognito withdrawals aren't being reused","admin":": authorized address to Pause and migrate contract","incognitoProxyAddress":": contract containing Incognito's committees"}},"deposit(string)":{"details":"Makes a ETH deposit to the vault to mint pETH over at Incognito Chain","params":{"incognitoAddress":": Incognito Address to receive pETH"}},"depositERC20(address,uint256,string)":{"details":"Makes a ERC20 deposit to the vault to mint pERC20 over at Incognito Chain","params":{"amount":": to deposit to the vault and mint on Incognito Chain","incognitoAddress":": Incognito Address to receive pERC20","token":": address of the ERC20 token"}},"execute(address,uint256,address,address,bytes,bytes32,bytes)":{"details":"execute is a general function that plays a role as proxy to interact to other smart contracts.","params":{"amount":": amount of the token in ethereum's denomination","callData":": encoded with signature and params of function from targeting smart contract.","exchangeAddress":": address of targeting smart contract that actually executes the desired logics like trade, invest, borrow and so on.","hash":": hash of the unique data generated from client (timestamp for example)","recipientToken":": received token address.","signData":": signature of an unique data that is signed by an account which is generated from user's incognito privkey","token":": ethereum's token address (eg., ETH, DAI, ...)"}},"getDecimals(address)":{"details":"Get the decimals of an ERC20 token, return 0 if it isn't defined We check the returndatasize to covert both cases that the token has and doesn't have the function decimals()"},"isSigDataUsed(bytes32)":{"details":"Checks if a sig data has been used before","params":{"hash":": of the sig data"},"return":"bool: whether the sig data has been used or not"},"isWithdrawed(bytes32)":{"details":"Checks if a burn proof has been used before","params":{"hash":": of the burn proof"},"return":"bool: whether the proof has been used or not"},"migrate(address)":{"details":"Saves the address of the new Vault to migrate assets to","params":{"_newVault":": address to save"}},"moveAssets(address[])":{"details":"Move some assets to newVault","params":{"assets":": address of the ERC20 tokens to move, 0x0 for ETH"}},"parseBurnInst(bytes)":{"details":"Parses a burn instruction and returns individual components","params":{"inst":": the full instruction, containing both metadata and body"},"return":"flag:meta: type of the instruction, 72 for burning instructionshard: ID of the Incognito shard containing the instruction, must be 1token: ETH address of the token contract (0x0 for ETH)to: ETH address of the receiver of the tokenamount: of tokens to return"},"requestWithdraw(string,address,uint256,bytes,bytes32)":{"details":"User requests withdraw token contains in withdrawRequests. Deposit event will be emitted to let incognito recognize and mint new p-tokens for the user.","params":{"amount":": amount of the token in ethereum's denomination","hash":": hash of the unique data generated from client (timestamp for example)","incognitoAddress":": incognito's address that will receive minted p-tokens.","signData":": signature of an unique data that is signed by an account which is generated from user's incognito privkey","token":": ethereum's token address (eg., ETH, DAI, ...)"}},"sigToAddress(bytes,bytes32)":{"details":"generate address from signature data and hash."},"submitBurnProof(bytes,uint256[2],bytes32[][2],bool[][2],bytes32[2],bytes32[2],uint256[][2],uint8[][2],bytes32[][2],bytes32[][2])":{"details":"Burnt Proof is submited to store burnt amount of p-token/p-ETH and receiver's address Receiver then can call withdrawRequest to withdraw these token to he/she incognito address.","params":{"blkData":": merkle has of the block body","heights":": the blocks containing the instruction","inst":": the decoded instruction as a list of bytes","instPathIsLefts":": whether each node on the path is the left or right child","instPaths":": merkle path of the instruction","instRoots":": root of the merkle tree contains all instructions","sigIdxs":": indices of the validators who signed this block","sigRs":": part of the signatures of the validators","sigSs":": part of the signatures of the validators","sigVs":": part of the signatures of the validators"}},"updateIncognitoProxy(address)":{"details":"Changes the IncognitoProxy to use","params":{"newIncognitoProxy":": address of the new contract"}},"withdraw(bytes,uint256[2],bytes32[][2],bool[][2],bytes32[2],bytes32[2],uint256[][2],uint8[][2],bytes32[][2],bytes32[][2])":{"details":"Withdraws pETH/pERC20 by providing a burn proof over at Incognito Chain","params":{"blkData":": merkle has of the block body","heights":": the blocks containing the instruction","inst":": the decoded instruction as a list of bytes","instPathIsLefts":": whether each node on the path is the left or right child","instPaths":": merkle path of the instruction","instRoots":": root of the merkle tree contains all instructions","sigIdxs":": indices of the validators who signed this block","sigRs":": part of the signatures of the validators","sigSs":": part of the signatures of the validators","sigVs":": part of the signatures of the validators"}}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"deposit(string)":{"notice":"This only works when the contract is not PausedThe maximum amount to deposit is capped since Incognito balance is stored as uint64"},"depositERC20(address,uint256,string)":{"notice":"This only works when the contract is not PausedThe maximum amount to deposit is capped since Incognito balance is stored as uint64Before calling this function, enough ERC20 must be allowed to tranfer from msg.sender to this contract"},"isSigDataUsed(bytes32)":{"notice":"First, we check inside the storage of this contract itself. If the hash has been used before, we return the result. Otherwise, we query previous vault recursively until the first Vault (prevVault address is 0x0)"},"isWithdrawed(bytes32)":{"notice":"First, we check inside the storage of this contract itself. If the hash has been used before, we return the result. Otherwise, we query previous vault recursively until the first Vault (prevVault address is 0x0)"},"migrate(address)":{"notice":"In case of emergency, Admin will Pause the contract, shutting down all incoming transactions. After a new contract with the fix is deployed, they will migrate assets to it and allow normal operations to resumeThis only works when the contract is PausedThis can only be called by Admin"},"moveAssets(address[])":{"notice":"This only works when the contract is PausedThis can only be called by Admin"},"submitBurnProof(bytes,uint256[2],bytes32[][2],bool[][2],bytes32[2],bytes32[2],uint256[][2],uint8[][2],bytes32[][2],bytes32[][2])":{"notice":"This function takes a burn instruction on Incognito Chain, checks for its validity and returns the token back to ETH chainThis only works when the contract is not PausedAll params except inst are the list of 2 elements corresponding to the proof on beacon and bridge"},"updateIncognitoProxy(address)":{"notice":"If the IncognitoProxy contract malfunctioned, Admin could config the Vault to use a new fixed IncognitoProxy contractThis only works when the contract is PausedThis can only be called by Admin"},"withdraw(bytes,uint256[2],bytes32[][2],bool[][2],bytes32[2],bytes32[2],uint256[][2],uint8[][2],bytes32[][2],bytes32[][2])":{"notice":"This function takes a burn instruction on Incognito beacon and devdoc.details: Responsible for holding the assets and issue minting instruction to Incognito Chain. Also, when presented with a burn proof created over at Incognito Chain, releases the tokens back to user

constructor.details: Creates new Vault to hold assets for Incognito Chain

params._prevVault: : previous version of the Vault to refer back if necessary After migrating all assets to a new Vault, we still need to refer back to previous Vault to make sure old withdrawals aren't being reused
params.admin: : authorized address to Pause and migrate contract

deposit(string).details: Makes a ETH deposit to the vault to mint pETH over at Incognito Chain

depositERC20(address,uint256,string).details: Makes a ERC20 deposit to the vault to mint pERC20 over at Incognito Chain

params.amount: : to deposit to the vault and mint on Incognito Chain

execute(address,uint256,address,address,.details: execute is a general function that plays a role as proxy to interact to other smart contracts.

params.amount: : amount of the token in ethereum's denomination
params.callData: : encoded with signature and params of function from targeting smart contract.
params.exchangeAddress: : address of targeting smart contract that actually executes the desired logics like trade, invest, borrow and so on.
params.hash: : hash of the unique data generated from client (timestamp for example)
params.signData: : signature of an unique data that is signed by an account which is generated from user's incognito privkey

getDecimals(address).details: Get the decimals of an ERC20 token, return 0 if it isn't defined We check the returndatasize to covert both cases that the token has and doesn't have the function decimals()

isSigDataUsed(bytes32).details: Checks if a sig data has been used before
isSigDataUsed(bytes32).return: bool: whether the sig data has been used or not

isWithdrawed(bytes32).details: Checks if a burn proof has been used before
isWithdrawed(bytes32).return: bool: whether the proof has been used or not

migrate(address).details: Saves the address of the new Vault to migrate assets to

params.assets: : address of the ERC20 tokens to move, 0x0 for ETH

parseBurnInst(bytes).details: Parses a burn instruction and returns individual components

params.inst: : the full instruction, containing both metadata and body

parseBurnInst(bytes).return: flag:meta: type of the instruction, 72 for burning instructionshard: ID of the Incognito shard containing the instruction, must be 1token: ETH address of the token contract (0x0 for ETH)to: ETH address of the receiver of the tokenamount: of tokens to return

requestWithdraw(string,address,uint256,b.details: User requests withdraw token contains in withdrawRequests. Deposit event will be emitted to let incognito recognize and mint new p-tokens for the user.

params.amount: : amount of the token in ethereum's denomination
params.hash: : hash of the unique data generated from client (timestamp for example)
params.incognitoAddress: : incognito's address that will receive minted p-tokens.
params.signData: : signature of an unique data that is signed by an account which is generated from user's incognito privkey

sigToAddress(bytes,bytes32).details: generate address from signature data and hash.

submitBurnProof(bytes,uint256[2],bytes32.details: Burnt Proof is submited to store burnt amount of p-token/p-ETH and receiver's address Receiver then can call withdrawRequest to withdraw these token to he/she incognito address.

params.blkData: : merkle has of the block body
params.inst: : the decoded instruction as a list of bytes
params.instPathIsLefts: : whether each node on the path is the left or right child
params.instRoots: : root of the merkle tree contains all instructions
params.sigIdxs: : indices of the validators who signed this block
params.sigRs: : part of the signatures of the validators
params.sigSs: : part of the signatures of the validators
params.sigVs: : part of the signatures of the validators

withdraw(bytes,uint256[2],bytes32[][2],b.details: Withdraws pETH/pERC20 by providing a burn proof over at Incognito Chain

params.blkData: : merkle has of the block body
params.inst: : the decoded instruction as a list of bytes
params.instPathIsLefts: : whether each node on the path is the left or right child
params.instRoots: : root of the merkle tree contains all instructions
params.sigIdxs: : indices of the validators who signed this block
params.sigRs: : part of the signatures of the validators
params.sigSs: : part of the signatures of the validators
params.sigVs: : part of the signatures of the validators

deposit(string).notice: This only works when the contract is not PausedThe maximum amount to deposit is capped since Incognito balance is stored as uint64

depositERC20(address,uint256,string).notice: This only works when the contract is not PausedThe maximum amount to deposit is capped since Incognito balance is stored as uint64Before calling this function, enough ERC20 must be allowed to tranfer from msg.sender to this contract

isSigDataUsed(bytes32).notice: First, we check inside the storage of this contract itself. If the hash has been used before, we return the result. Otherwise, we query previous vault recursively until the first Vault (prevVault address is 0x0)

isWithdrawed(bytes32).notice: First, we check inside the storage of this contract itself. If the hash has been used before, we return the result. Otherwise, we query previous vault recursively until the first Vault (prevVault address is 0x0)

migrate(address).notice: In case of emergency, Admin will Pause the contract, shutting down all incoming transactions. After a new contract with the fix is deployed, they will migrate assets to it and allow normal operations to resumeThis only works when the contract is PausedThis can only be called by Admin

moveAssets(address[]).notice: This only works when the contract is PausedThis can only be called by Admin

submitBurnProof(bytes,uint256[2],bytes32.notice: This function takes a burn instruction on Incognito Chain, checks for its validity and returns the token back to ETH chainThis only works when the contract is not PausedAll params except inst are the list of 2 elements corresponding to the proof on beacon and bridge

updateIncognitoProxy(address).notice: If the IncognitoProxy contract malfunctioned, Admin could config the Vault to use a new fixed IncognitoProxy contractThis only works when the contract is PausedThis can only be called by Admin

withdraw(bytes,uint256[2],bytes32[][2],b.notice: This function takes a burn instruction on Incognito Chain, checks for its validity and returns the token back to ETH chainThis only works when the contract is not PausedAll params except inst are the list of 2 elements corresponding to the proof on beacon and bridge
